business.headline: GST Council meeting today: What's likely to get cheaper and costlierAt the centre of discussions is a plan to simplify the current four-tier system into just two slabs—5% and 18%—potentially making daily essentials and electronic goods more affordable while introducing higher levies on luxury items.

Sensex, Nifty fall after opening in green, GST Council meeting in focusAt 9:25 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading nearly 100 points lower, while the NSE Nifty50 was also down marginally. Banking and financial stocks were among the top drags, reflecting investor caution amid global uncertainty and ongoing trade tensions.

GST Council meet today: Key decisions on tax cuts, 2-slab structure in focusThe Centre's proposal, described as a 'next-gen' GST reform, aims to prune the current four-tier tax structure into just two slabs—5% and 18%. This would mean doing away with the 12% and 28% brackets introduced when GST was launched in July 2017.

Centre finalises 25 priority products for indigenous semiconductor IPs: IT MinisterIT and Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the semiconductor design ecosystem was growing faster than expected, with more than 28 startups moving from concept to product stage under the design-linked incentive scheme.

Markets end in red, Gold soars to all-time high and moreSensex and Nifty slipped into the red after early gains dragged by banks and heavyweight counters. Nifty fell below 24,600 marks while Sensex closed at 80,200. Mid-caps as well as the small-cap indices have been outperforming with modest gains.

PNB, Bank of India cut MCLR: What it means for borrowersPunjab National Bank has made small reductions across different loan tenures. The overnight rate has come down from 8.15% to 8%. The one-month MCLR has dropped slightly to 8.25%, while the three-month rate has been reduced to 8.45%.

Luxury EVs may get costlier as tax panel proposes steep GST hike: ReportThe proposal, if approved, would hit global brands such as Tesla, Mercedes-Benz, BMW and BYD the hardest, just as they ramp up their India play.

How extreme weather is driving up India's food pricesExperts warn that climate change is making such weather events more frequent, leading to higher volatility in vegetable prices and overall food inflation.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as financial stocks fall; all eyes on GST Council meetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 206.61 points to 80,157.88 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 45.45 points lower at 24,579.60.

How much should you save in an emergency fund? Here's the answerWhen crisis knocks, credit cards and loans only add stress. An emergency fund keeps you afloat without debt. The tricky part is figuring out how much you should save. Let's break it down.

Brass city in crisis: Jobs of over 2 lakh Moradabad artisans at risk from US tariffsUS tariffs have struck Moradabad's export-reliant brass industry, freezing shipments, cutting jobs, and throwing the livelihoods of thousands of artisans and workers into immediate jeopardy.

Hope we can reach trade deal with US by November, says Piyush GoyalCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said India is holding talks with the United States on a bilateral trade agreement, day after Trump called ties with India "one-sided diaster".

entertainment.headline: Akshay Kumar wears traditional mundu for Guruvayur temple visit in KeralaAkshay Kumar, shooting in Kerala, visited the famous Guruvayur temple in traditional attire. The actor is in the state shooting for his next film, 'Haiwaan', with Priyadarshan.

Janhvi Kapoor recalls being hounded after Sridevi's death, slammed for smilingJanhvi Kapoor opened up about the difficult phase of promoting her debut film 'Dhadak' soon after the sudden death of her mother, legendary actor Sridevi. The 'Param Sundari' star recalled how she and sister Khushi Kapoor were "hounded" by the media.

Marathi singer Rahul Deshpande announces separation from wife Neha after 17 yearsMarathi singer-actor Rahul Deshpande announced his separation from wife Neha after 17 years of marriage. He shared a statement on social media and spoke about co-parenting their daughter, Renuka.

Exclusive: Shanaya Kapoor to headline series on Student of The Year'Student of the Year', a popular franchise from Dharma Productions, is set to return as a digital series featuring Shanaya Kapoor. The show will explore themes of friendship, rivalry, ambition and romance with a fresh cast and modern setting.

Did you know that Novak Djokovic is a KPop Demon Hunters fan?Tennis player Novak Djokovic recently unveiled his love for Netflix's popular animated film KPop Demon Hunters. He shared that he dances to the song 'Soda Pop'.

Param Sundari box office Day 5: Sidharth-Janhvi film gets push, earns Rs 34 croreSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's latest release, Param Sundari, slightly increased its numbers on Tuesday. The film is now inching close to Rs 50 crore at the domestic box office.

Priya Varrier appears as extra in Param Sundari amid Malayali representation rowMalayalam actor Priya Prakash Varrier, popularly known as 'Wink Girl', appeared as a background actor in Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra's 'Param Sundari'. Fans were surprised to see her in the background and said that she should have played Janhvi Kapoor's role, a half-Malayali, half-Tamilian.

Rajamouli meets Kenya minister amid SSMB 29 shoot, film to release in 120 countriesSS Rajamouli wrapped up the African schedule of his latest film 'SSMB 29' in Kenya, showcasing iconic African locations. He met Kenyan minister Musalia Mudavadi and other delegates.

Sonakshi Sinha slams online brands for using her photos without permissionSonakshi Sinha has called out online brands for using her social media photos on their websites without permission or usage rights. She urged companies to act ethically and warned them to take down her images before she names them publicly.

Millie Bobby Brown shares first photo of baby girl with Jake BongioviHollywood actor Millie Bobby Brown, best known as Eleven from 'Stranger Things', is embracing life as a young mum at 21. Here's a glimpse into her family life with husband Jake Bongiovi and their baby girl.

Dwayne Johnson's drastic weight loss leaves fans stunned at Venice Film FestivalDwayne 'The Rock' Johnson appeared at the photocall and press conference for his latest film 'The Smashing Machine' where his noticeably leaner physique took many by surprise.

Inspector Zende to Wednesday, new releases on Netflix to watch this weekNetflix is bringing a fresh lineup this week with something for everyone - action, gothic drama, comedy-thriller, and a hard-hitting documentary. Highlights include 'The Fall Guy', 'Wednesday: Season 2 Part 2', 'Inspector Zende', and 'Love Con Revenge'.

FIR filed against Sanjay Leela Bhansali in Bikaner over Love & War disputeAn FIR has been registered against filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali and two others in Bikaner after a man accused them of fraud, misbehaviour, and breach of trust during the making of 'Love & War'.

Naveen Kasturia on Salakaar being a series of firsts, challenges of playing a spyActor Naveen Kasturia steps into his first spy role in the JioHotstar thriller 'Salakaar'. In an exclusive interview, Naveen talks about the challenges of the role.

Mirai: Shriya Saran's first look from Teja Sajja's sci-fi film outAfter 'Retro', Shriya Saran is set to appear in her second film in 2025. 10 days ahead of its release, Teja Sajja unveiled the first look of Saran from their upcoming Telugu sci-fi drama 'Mirai'.

Tridev's Sonam turns 53, eyes comeback with strong roles in films and OTTActor Sonam celebrates her 53rd birthday reflecting on her early Bollywood success and long hiatus. She is now ready to return with meaningful roles in films and OTT platforms, embracing her age and experience.

The Weeknd's Blinding Lights becomes 1st track to cross 5 billion streams on SpotifyThe Weeknd's 'Blinding Lights' has made history as the first song to hit five billion streams on Spotify. This milestone comes shortly after topping Billboard's Top Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs of the 21st Century chart.

From Omi to OG: Pawan Kalyan receives special birthday wish from Emraan HashmiThe makers of 'OG' celebrated Pawan Kalyan's birthday in an unconventional style by releasing a special video featuring Emraan Hashmi's character, Omi. The film will be released globally on September 25, 2025.

Kiran Rao, Biju Toppo back Humans in the Loop before September releaseKiran Rao and Biju Toppo have joined as executive producers for the indie film Humans in the Loop. The film highlights invisible AI labour through an Adivasi woman's story, raising questions about technology and indigenous knowledge.

general news.headline: We get along very well, but...: Trump on US-India ties amid tariff disputeThe US President also claimed that unfair tariff structures were pushing companies to set up production outside America. However, he argued that his administration's trade policies, including the imposition of steep reciprocal tariffs, were beginning to reverse the trend.

GST Council meet today: Key decisions on tax cuts, 2-slab structure in focusThe Centre's proposal, described as a 'next-gen' GST reform, aims to prune the current four-tier tax structure into just two slabs—5% and 18%. This would mean doing away with the 12% and 28% brackets introduced when GST was launched in July 2017.

Russia, India in talks for more S-400 missile systems despite US pressureNew Delhi signed a $5.5 billion agreement with Moscow in 2018 for five S-400 Triumf systems, meant to counter China's growing military power. The deal has faced repeated delays, with the final two units now scheduled for 2026 and 2027.

18 Virat Kohlis in one side? Why Indian men's hockey team is built to win bigMental conditioning coach Paddy Upton, in an exclusive chat with India Today, revealed his amazement at the fitness of the Indian men's hockey team, calling them a side that has 18 Virat Kohlis in it. Upton also spoke about his current work with the team and praised Craig Fulton as a coach.

Cracks beneath concrete: Why India's urban planning fails against floodsRoads do not collapse in isolation. Nor do drains clog themselves. What we are witnessing—from Gurugram's flooded boulevards to Delhi's crumbling flyovers—is the slow, visible erosion of a planning culture that treats cities as finished products rather than evolving organisms.

Indian refiners signalling reduction of Russian oil imports: US CongressmanA US intelligence delegation led by Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick visited India, Nepal, and Pakistan, pushing India to reduce Russian oil imports and advancing counterterrorism coordination with allies in Islamabad.

As Xi hosts Putin, Kim at Beijing parade, Trump fumes at 'conspiracy against US'US President Trump accused Chinese President Xi Jinping of conspiring with Russia and North Korea as the leaders of the three countries came together for Beijing's largest military parade.

Meet Vijay Raji, Indian-origin engineer from Puducherry named new OpenAI Applications CTOOpenAI is overhauling its applications arm under new chief Fidji Simo, acquiring Statsig for $1.1bn and appointing founder Vijaye Raji as CTO of Applications.

On daughter's birthday, Djokovic turns US Open quarters win into a dance of loveUS Open 2025: Novak Djokovic celebrated his daughter Tara's eighth birthday with a special dance after beating Taylor Fritz in the quarter-finals. The Serb will face second seed Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster semi-final.

UP woman, 52, killed by 26-year-old boyfriend she met on InstagramA 52-year-old woman from Farrukhabad was strangled in Mainpuri, Uttar Pradesh, allegedly by her 26-year-old lover she had met on Instagram. Police said the accused, Arun Rajput, killed her after she pressed him for marriage and repayment of money loaned.

Shehbaz Sharif perfectly fine with India-Russia ties, but has a demandPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Beijing and told him that Islamabad respects Moscow's close diplomatic relations with New Delhi.

Heavy rain chokes Delhi-NCR, schools shut, flood alert issued, NDRF teams deployedAs of 5:00 am today, the Yamuna's water level at the Old Railway Bridge reached 206.78 meters, exceeding the government's earlier estimate of 206.50 meters.

Priya Varrier appears as extra in Param Sundari amid Malayali representation rowMalayalam actor Priya Prakash Varrier, popularly known as 'Wink Girl', appeared as a background actor in Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra's 'Param Sundari'. Fans were surprised to see her in the background and said that she should have played Janhvi Kapoor's role, a half-Malayali, half-Tamilian.

GST Council meeting today: What's likely to get cheaper and costlierAt the centre of discussions is a plan to simplify the current four-tier system into just two slabs—5% and 18%—potentially making daily essentials and electronic goods more affordable while introducing higher levies on luxury items.

Ravichandran Ashwin may join Big Bash League after IPL retirementRavichandran Ashwin is reportedly in talks to join the Big Bash League (BBL), with discussions already underway ahead of the upcoming season of Australia's premier T20 competition.

Have no fear: California Governor Newsom mocks Trump with Modi, Putin, Xi videoPresident Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would deploy National Guard troops to fight crime in Chicago, an extraordinary effort to militarise the country's third-largest city that was likely to trigger a legal battle with local officials.

Gen Z doesn't just want jobs. They want workplaces that don't drain themFrom startups to corporates, the Gen Z influence is rewriting how work is done, relaxed culture, flat structures, and growth-driven spaces are replacing old office rules.

Signed, adopted by Pak: P Chidambaram slams SCO Tianjin Declaration as inaneCongress MP P Chidambaram has criticised the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation's Tianjin Declaration, calling it "inane" and pointing to Pakistan's endorsement as proof that global platforms fail to distinguish between "terrorism-exporting" and "terrorism-affected" nations.

Video: Tamil Nadu school headmaster lies on table, students massage her legsA viral video from a primary school in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri has sparked outrage, showing children pressing their headmaster's legs in class, prompting officials to launch an inquiry into the incident.

From GPT-5 routing to parental controls: All the steps OpenAI is taking to make ChatGPT saferOpenAI has announced a series of updates aimed at making ChatGPT safer for teenagers and for people who may be going through mental health struggles.

When you deliver...: Karnataka MLA's shocker on journalist's hospital questionDeshpande's response to a journalist's question regarding the lack of a hospital in Joida taluk has drawn widespread criticism for its tone and perceived insensitivity.

India alerts Pakistan of potential Sutlej flooding amid heavy rain: ReportThe Ministry of External Affairs alerted Pakistan of likely floods in Sutlej. This comes after India alerted the neighbouring nation thrice of possible flooding in the river Tawi.

New AI stethoscope detects three major heart problems in 15 secondsA new AI-enabled stethoscope can detect three major heart problems within seconds. This technology provides quicker diagnosis and earlier detection in general clinics.

Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam denied bail again: Decoding the Delhi High Court orderThe Delhi High Court on Tuesday denied bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and seven others accused in the 2020 northeast Delhi riots "larger conspiracy" case under UAPA. It rejected defence arguments on prolonged incarceration, lack of direct evidence and parity with earlier bail orders, citing UAPA's strict bail provisions and pending witness testimony.

sports.headline: Ravichandran Ashwin may join Big Bash League after IPL retirementRavichandran Ashwin is reportedly in talks to join the Big Bash League (BBL), with discussions already underway ahead of the upcoming season of Australia's premier T20 competition.

On daughter's birthday, Djokovic turns US Open quarters win into a dance of loveUS Open 2025: Novak Djokovic celebrated his daughter Tara's eighth birthday with a special dance after beating Taylor Fritz in the quarter-finals. The Serb will face second seed Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster semi-final.

Flashback to 2010: Harbhajan Singh, Shoaib Akhtar's fiery Asia Cup exchangeThe 2010 Asia Cup match between India and Pakistan featured a dramatic final over and heated exchanges between Shoaib Akhtar and Harbhajan Singh.

Don't know why Root reacted that way: Prasidh on heated altercation in 5th TestIndia pacer Prasidh Krishna has opened up about his on-field exchange with Joe Root during the fifth Test at the Oval, saying he was unsure why the senior batter reacted so heatedly.

Venus Williams offers update on future after age-defying doubles run endsVenus Williams offered an update on her tennis future after bowing out of the U.S. Open on Tuesday, her campaign alongside Canadian Leylah Fernandez ending with a quarter-final defeat in the women's doubles.

18 Virat Kohlis in one side? Why Indian men's hockey team is built to win bigMental conditioning coach Paddy Upton, in an exclusive chat with India Today, revealed his amazement at the fitness of the Indian men's hockey team, calling them a side that has 18 Virat Kohlis in it. Upton also spoke about his current work with the team and praised Craig Fulton as a coach.

Sabalenka reaches semifinals after Vondrousova withdraws due to injuryWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka advanced to the semifinals of the US Open on Tuesday without having to play a point, after her quarterfinal opponent, Marketa Vondrousova, withdrew due to a knee injury.

Indian teen prodigy Maaya Rajeshwaran turns heads despite 2nd-round exitUS Open 2025: 16-year-old Maaya Rajeshwaran narrowly missed an upset against second seed Hannah Klugman at the US Open junior girls singles. Maaya made a mark with her all-round game in New York on Tuesday.

US Open: Golf on off-days working wonders as Carlos Alcaraz storms into semisCarlos Alcaraz is blending tennis and golf to perfection. After a commanding straight-sets win over Jiri Lehecka, the Spaniard credits his off-court golf sessions for focus, calm, and energy heading into the US Open semi-finals.

Ahead of Asia Cup, Afghanistan stun Pakistan in T20I tri-series in SharjahAfghanistan stunned Pakistan by 18 runs in Sharjah, showcasing brilliant spin bowling and a crucial 65-run innings by Ibrahim Zadran. The win boosts Afghanistan ahead of the Asia Cup and raises alarms for Pakistan's lineup.

Supreme Court appoints ex-judge LN Rao to oversee AIFF-FSDL ISL 2025-26 resolutionSupreme Court approves AIFF-FSDL consensual resolution, appointing Justice LN Rao to oversee ISL commercial partner selection. The move ensures a timely 2025-26 Indian football season while averting potential FIFA-AFC suspension.

Sabalenka reaches semifinals after Vondrousova withdraws due to injuryWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka advanced to the semifinals of the US Open on Tuesday without having to play a point, after her quarterfinal opponent, Marketa Vondrousova, withdrew due to a knee injury.

Indian teen prodigy Maaya Rajeshwaran turns heads despite 2nd-round exitUS Open 2025: 16-year-old Maaya Rajeshwaran narrowly missed an upset against second seed Hannah Klugman at the US Open junior girls singles. Maaya made a mark with her all-round game in New York on Tuesday.

US Open: Golf on off-days working wonders as Carlos Alcaraz storms into semisCarlos Alcaraz is blending tennis and golf to perfection. After a commanding straight-sets win over Jiri Lehecka, the Spaniard credits his off-court golf sessions for focus, calm, and energy heading into the US Open semi-finals.

Ahead of Asia Cup, Afghanistan stun Pakistan in T20I tri-series in SharjahAfghanistan stunned Pakistan by 18 runs in Sharjah, showcasing brilliant spin bowling and a crucial 65-run innings by Ibrahim Zadran. The win boosts Afghanistan ahead of the Asia Cup and raises alarms for Pakistan's lineup.

Supreme Court appoints ex-judge LN Rao to oversee AIFF-FSDL ISL 2025-26 resolutionSupreme Court approves AIFF-FSDL consensual resolution, appointing Justice LN Rao to oversee ISL commercial partner selection. The move ensures a timely 2025-26 Indian football season while averting potential FIFA-AFC suspension.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
